commit.message:
configure.in (gcc_cv_as_bfd_srcdir): New.

	* configure.in (gcc_cv_as_bfd_srcdir): New.  Use it to find gas
	version in single tree build.
	* configure: Regenerate.

From-SVN: r46275

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,9 @@
+2001-10-16  Alan Modra  <amodra@bigpond.net.au>
+
+	* configure.in (gcc_cv_as_bfd_srcdir): New.  Use it to find gas
+	version in single tree build.
+	* configure: Regenerate.
+
 2001-10-15  David Edelsohn  <edelsohn@gnu.org>
 
 	* config/rs6000/rs6000.md (cr_logical): Swap order of CODE and

@@ -5289,26 +5289,17 @@ if test "${build}" != "${host}" && test "x$enable_nls" = "xyes"; then
   enable_nls=no
 fi
 
-# if NLS is enabled, also enable check in po subdir
-if test $enable_nls = yes; then
-  CHECK_PO=check-po
-else
-  CHECK_PO=""
-fi
-
-
-
 
             
 echo $ac_n "checking for library containing strerror""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5305: checking for library containing strerror" >&5
+echo "configure:5296: checking for library containing strerror" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_search_strerror'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_func_search_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 ac_cv_search_strerror="no"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5312 "configure"
+#line 5303 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5319,7 +5310,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5323: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5314: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_search_strerror="none required"
 else
@@ -5330,7 +5321,7 @@ rm -f conftest*
 test "$ac_cv_search_strerror" = "no" && for i in cposix; do
 LIBS="-l$i  $ac_func_search_save_LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5334 "configure"
+#line 5325 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5341,7 +5332,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5345: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5336: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_search_strerror="-l$i"
 break
@@ -5364,12 +5355,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5368: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:5359: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5373 "configure"
+#line 5364 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -5418,7 +5409,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5422: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5413: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -5439,12 +5430,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5443: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:5434: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5448 "configure"
+#line 5439 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -5472,12 +5463,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5476: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:5467: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5481 "configure"
+#line 5472 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -5507,19 +5498,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5511: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:5502: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5516 "configure"
+#line 5507 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5523: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5514: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -5540,12 +5531,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5544: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:5535: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5549 "configure"
+#line 5540 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -5573,7 +5564,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5577: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5568: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -5605,12 +5596,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5609: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:5600: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5614 "configure"
+#line 5605 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -5635,12 +5626,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5639: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:5630: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5644 "configure"
+#line 5635 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -5663,7 +5654,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5667: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5658: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -5690,15 +5681,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5694: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:5685: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5702 "configure"
+#line 5693 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -5717,7 +5708,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5721: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:5712: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -5740,12 +5731,12 @@ fi
 
 
     echo $ac_n "checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5744: checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer" >&5
+echo "configure:5735: checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_gnu_library_2_1'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5749 "configure"
+#line 5740 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <features.h>
@@ -5781,17 +5772,17 @@ stdlib.h string.h unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5785: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:5776: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5790 "configure"
+#line 5781 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:5795: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:5786: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -5822,12 +5813,12 @@ getgid getuid mempcpy munmap putenv setenv setlocale stpcpy strchr strcasecmp \
 strdup strtoul tsearch __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5826: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:5817: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5831 "configure"
+#line 5822 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -5850,7 +5841,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5854: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5845: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -5890,15 +5881,15 @@ fi
 
 
   echo $ac_n "checking for iconv""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5894: checking for iconv" >&5
+echo "configure:5885: checking for iconv" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_func_iconv'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   
     am_cv_func_iconv="no, consider installing GNU libiconv"
     am_cv_lib_iconv=no
     cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5902 "configure"
+#line 5893 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 #include <iconv.h>
@@ -5908,7 +5899,7 @@ iconv_t cd = iconv_open("","");
        iconv_close(cd);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5912: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5903: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_func_iconv=yes
 else
@@ -5920,7 +5911,7 @@ rm -f conftest*
       am_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
       LIBS="$LIBS -liconv"
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5924 "configure"
+#line 5915 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 #include <iconv.h>
@@ -5930,7 +5921,7 @@ iconv_t cd = iconv_open("","");
          iconv_close(cd);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5934: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5925: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_lib_iconv=yes
         am_cv_func_iconv=yes
@@ -5951,13 +5942,13 @@ echo "$ac_t""$am_cv_func_iconv" 1>&6
 EOF
 
     echo $ac_n "checking for iconv declaration""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5955: checking for iconv declaration" >&5
+echo "configure:5946: checking for iconv declaration" >&5
     if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_proto_iconv'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5961 "configure"
+#line 5952 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdlib.h>
@@ -5976,7 +5967,7 @@ int main() {
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5980: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5971: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_proto_iconv_arg1=""
 else
@@ -6005,19 +5996,19 @@ EOF
 
    
   echo $ac_n "checking for nl_langinfo and CODESET""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6009: checking for nl_langinfo and CODESET" >&5
+echo "configure:6000: checking for nl_langinfo and CODESET" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_langinfo_codeset'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6014 "configure"
+#line 6005 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <langinfo.h>
 int main() {
 char* cs = nl_langinfo(CODESET);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6021: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6012: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_langinfo_codeset=yes
 else
@@ -6040,19 +6031,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6044: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:6035: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6049 "configure"
+#line 6040 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6056: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6047: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -6073,7 +6064,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6077: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:6068: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -6095,7 +6086,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6099: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:6090: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -6115,17 +6106,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6119: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6110: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6124 "configure"
+#line 6115 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6129: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6120: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6142,12 +6133,12 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for GNU gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6146: checking for GNU gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:6137: checking for GNU gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6151 "configure"
+#line 6142 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 extern int _nl_msg_cat_cntr;
@@ -6156,7 +6147,7 @@ bindtextdomain ("", "");
 return (int) gettext ("") + _nl_msg_cat_cntr
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6160: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6151: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libc=yes
 else
@@ -6172,14 +6163,14 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libc" 1>&6
 
 	   if test "$gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libc" != "yes"; then
 	     echo $ac_n "checking for GNU gettext in libintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6176: checking for GNU gettext in libintl" >&5
+echo "configure:6167: checking for GNU gettext in libintl" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libintl'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   gt_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 		LIBS="$LIBS -lintl $LIBICONV"
 		cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6183 "configure"
+#line 6174 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 extern int _nl_msg_cat_cntr;
@@ -6188,7 +6179,7 @@ bindtextdomain ("", "");
 return (int) gettext ("") + _nl_msg_cat_cntr
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6192: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6183: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gnugettext1_libintl=yes
 else
@@ -6221,12 +6212,12 @@ EOF
 	     for ac_func in dcgettext
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6225: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6216: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6230 "configure"
+#line 6221 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6249,7 +6240,7 @@ $ac_func();
